subject: Putting the '6' in 2016

entries.title: A review of the 2015 CPAN Pull Request Challenge
entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: Neil offers a retrospective of the first year of the CPAN Pull Request Challenge, complete with spiffy graphs and all the trimmings.
Having more women as keynote speakers for YAPC::EU would be very nifty. Neil, bless his heart, goes beyond the mere wishing and draws a list of peeps who would be awesome candidates.
entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.title: Women keynotes speakers for YAPC::EU 2016
Perl 5 and Perl 6 are mortal enemies
entries.text: Most people see Perl 5 and 6 as siblings. David goes further, and see them as Cain and Abel. Who happen to be Highlanders. Stuck in an infernal device created by the Jigsaw killer.
entries.author: david_golden

entries.text: A (legitimate) question peeps have about Perl 6 is "what are the differenciators with Perl 5?". Well, asynchronous programming is one. This blog entry argues why this is a big thing.
entries.author: jt_smith
entries.title: Perl 6's Killer App - Async

entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: Every troubleshooting session should begin with "is it turned on?". Likewise, each test  run should begin with "does it compile?".
entries.title: Save time with compile tests

entries.text: A blog entry on blogs.perl.org about how to use 'swat' to monitor the health status of blogs.perl.org. A blogception of some sort, if you will.
entries.author: alexey_melezhik
entries.title: Swat tests for blogs.perl.org
A note about String::Flogger and logging in dzil
entries.text: String::Flogger, used amongst other things by Log::Dispatchouli, does quite a few clever things to make logging messages more DWIMish.
entries.author: steven_haryanto

entries.title: Active State: Installing CPAN Modules on ActivePerl 5.18 and Later
entries.text: Using ActiveState Perl? Here's a refresher on how to install CPAN modules in this environment.

entries.title: Automating Deployments: Debian Packaging for an Example Project
entries.author: moritz_lenz
entries.text: How to bundle and deploy projects via Debian packaging.
Jonathan takes us along his implementation of his STOMP client.
entries.author: jonathan_worthington
entries.title: Not guts, but 6: part 1

entries.text: Where a Perl6 Grammar is implemented to parse PHP code.
entries.title: Perl 6 grammars redux

entries.author: mike_friedman
entries.text: A short primer on Perl 6. What's the terminology, where to get it, and the first few things to know to get you going.
entries.title: Exploring Perl 6: Up and Running
Async Aborts and P6SGI
entries.text: The P6SGI -- the Perl 6 PSGI port --  adventures continue. Here, an async problem is encountered, and a cry for help is made.
entries.author: sterling_hanenkamp

entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: December 28th, January 4th

entries.title: NICEPERL's lists
entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

header: This week, a little bit of 2015 retrospectives, and a lot of Perl 6 -- from tutorials, to opinions to what could be its killer feature, to doomsday predictions. Enjoy! ~ `/anick
